page.title: 12TUTHILL MANOR
page.content: One of the most outstanding houses in the village is Tuthill Manor which stands in an elevated position to the North of the Church. The site of the manor is believed to date back to Roman times and evidence of a Norman Castle has been found in the grounds. The earliest part of the house dates from the 15th century, that being a Beacon House. By 1563, a large open hall had been added & around 1600 the residents, the Turner family, added two wings. Later,the house was converted into cottages which were occupied until the 1950's. In 1961 Mr. Rex Corbett bought the now derelict buildings and for 17 years, he and his wife,Elma, have devoted every spare moment to restoring the Manor to a home of outstanding charm and beauty with a dream garden which reflects the hours of love bestowed upon it.
